main event: A civilian observed one red circular object in Northport, Maine on 22 July 1957, which appeared to be stationary and then moved east, reflecting through the fog. The object was in sight for two to three minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as reddish and indistinctive, possibly an optical sighting caused by searching or seeing similar light.
There was insufficient data to make a conclusive determination about the nature of the object.
The sighting took place in the early morning hours, which may have affected visibility and perception.
The object remained stationary for a period before moving, which could indicate unique behavior.
The report was classified as a ground-visual observation, indicating that the object was observed from the ground without the aid of instruments.
